Label: place of birth
Desc: most specific known (e.g. city instead of country, or hospital instead of city) birth location of a person, animal or fictional character

Label: place of death
Desc: most specific known (e.g. city instead of country, or hospital instead of city) death location of a person, animal or fictional character

Label: subclass of
Desc: all instances of these items are instances of those items; this item is a class (subset) of that item. Not to be confused with P31 (instance of)

Label: official language
Desc: language designated as official by this item

Label: position played on team / speciality
Desc: position or specialism of a player on a team, e.g. Small Forward

Label: award received
Desc: award or recognition received by a person, organisation or creative work

Label: original network
Desc: network(s) the radio or television show was originally aired on,  including

Label: educated at
Desc: educational institution attended by subject
English Template: [X] was educated at the University of [Y] .

Label: shares border with
Desc: countries or administrative subdivisions, of equal level, that this item borders, either by land or water

Label: named after
Desc: entity or event that inspired the subject's name, or namesake (in at least one language)

Label: original language of film or TV show
Desc: language in which a film or a performance work was originally created. Deprecated for written works; use P407 ("language of work or name") instead.

Label: member of sports team
Desc: sports teams or clubs that the subject currently represents or formerly represented

Label: member of
Desc: organization or club to which the subject belongs. Do not use for membership in ethnic or social groups, nor for holding a position such as a member of parliament (use P39 for that).

Label: field of work
Desc: specialization of a person or organization; see P106 for the occupation

Label: participating team
Desc: Like 'Participant' (P710) but for teams. For an event like a cycle race or a football match you can use this property to list the teams and P710 to list the individuals (with 'member of sports team' (P54)' as a qualifier for the individuals)

Label: occupation
Desc: occupation of a person; see also "field of work" (Property:P101), "position held" (Property:P39)

Label: has part
Desc: part of this subject; inverse property of "part of" (P361). See also "has parts of the class" (P2670).

Label: member of political party
Desc: the political party of which this politician is or has been a member
English Template: [X] is a member of the [Y] political party .

Label: diplomatic relation
Desc: diplomatic relations of the country

Label: manufacturer
Desc: manufacturer or producer of this product

Label: country of citizenship
Desc: the object is a country that recognizes the subject as its citizen

Label: language of work or name
Desc: language associated with this creative work (such as books, shows, songs, or websites) or a name (for persons use P103 and P1412)

Label: continent
Desc: continent of which the subject is a part

Label: developer
Desc: organisation or person that developed the item

Label: capital of
Desc: country, state, department, canton or other administrative division of which the municipality is the governmental seat

Label: located in the administrative territorial entity
Desc: the item is located on the territory of the following administrative entity. Use P276 (location) for specifying the location of non-administrative places and for items about events

Label: languages spoken, written or signed
Desc: language(s) that a person speaks or writes, including the native language(s)

Label: employer
Desc: person or organization for which the subject works or worked

Label: genre
Desc: creative work's genre or an artist's field of work (P101). Use main subject (P921) to relate creative works to their topic

Label: country
Desc: sovereign state of this item; don't use on humans

Label: position held
Desc: subject currently or formerly holds the object position or public office

Label: record label
Desc: brand and trademark associated with the marketing of subject music recordings and music videos

Label: location
Desc: location of the item, physical object or event is within. In case of an administrative entity use P131. In case of a distinct terrain feature use P706.

Label: work location
Desc: location where persons were active

Label: religion
Desc: religion of a person, organization or religious building, or associated with this subject

Label: instrument
Desc: musical instrument that a person plays

Label: owned by
Desc: owner of the subject

Label: native language
Desc: language or languages a person has learned from early childhood

Label: twinned administrative body
Desc: twin towns, sister cities, twinned municipalities and other localities that have a partnership or cooperative agreement, either legally or informally acknowledged by their governments

Label: applies to jurisdiction
Desc: the item (an institution, law, public office ...) or statement belongs to or has power over or applies to the value (a territorial jurisdiction: a country, state, municipality, ...)

Label: instance of
Desc: that class of which this subject is a particular example and member (subject typically an individual member with a proper name label); different from P279; using this property as a qualifier is deprecated—use P2868 or P3831 instead

Label: country of origin
Desc: country of origin of this item (creative work, food, phrase, product, etc.)

Label: headquarters location
Desc: specific location where an organization's headquarters is or has been situated. Inverse property of "occupant" (P466).

Label: capital
Desc: primary city of a country, state or other type of administrative territorial entity

Label: location of formation
Desc: location where a group or organization was formed

Label: part of
Desc: object of which the subject is a part (it's not useful to link objects which are themselves parts of other objects already listed as parts of the subject). Inverse property of "has part" (P527, see also "has parts of the class" (P2670)).
